definition: rare earth metallic elements with atomic numbers 57-71, typically soft and reactive with similar chemical properties

positive_examples: The neodymium magnets in the hard drive are incredibly strong
Cerium oxide is used as a polishing compound for glass
The europium in the phosphor gives the screen its red color
Samarium-cobalt magnets work well at high temperatures
Gadolinium contrast agents help improve MRI image quality
Terbium is essential for the green phosphors in fluorescent lights
negative_examples: Scandium and yttrium are also rare earth elements but not lanthanides
Actinium is radioactive but belongs to the actinide series instead
Hafnium has similar properties but is a transition metal
Thorium is found in rare earth ores but is an actinide
Zirconium often occurs with rare earths but is not a lanthanide
Titanium dioxide is used in similar applications but is not a rare earth
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Actinides, TransitionMetals, AlkaliMetals, NobleGases, Halogens
